docs.snippet: Latvia expressed sadness on Wednesday over the banning of the drug that has cast a pall over the career of tennis star Maria Sharapova, describing it as "one of the most significant accomplishments" of the tiny nation's scientists.
docs.lead_paragraph: Latvia expressed sadness on Wednesday over the banning of the drug that has cast a pall over the career of tennis star Maria Sharapova, describing it as "one of the most significant accomplishments" of the tiny nation's scientists.

headline.main: Proud Latvia Regrets Ban on Meldonium Drug Its Scientists Invented
headline.print_headline: Proud Latvia Regrets Ban on Meldonium Drug Its Scientists Invented

docs.snippet: Some West Virginia lawmakers and Capitol staffers had a very bad weekend after drinking raw milk to celebrate a law loosening restrictions on the product. Now state health officials are investigating whether the milk was to blame for their fever,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Some West Virginia lawmakers and Capitol staffers had a very bad weekend after drinking raw milk to celebrate a law loosening restrictions on the product. Now state health officials are investigating whether the milk was to blame for their fever, vomiting and diarrhea, and weighing allegations the raw-milk party broke the law.

headline.main: Lawmakers Celebrate Raw Milk, Deny Being Sickened by It
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Celebrate Raw Milk, Deny Being Sickened by It

docs.snippet: The African Union will send a mission to northern Mali in the next few weeks to look into setting up a counter-terrorism force to support vulnerable U.N. peacekeepers, sources familiar with the matter said.
docs.lead_paragraph: The African Union will send a mission to northern Mali in the next few weeks to look into setting up a counter-terrorism force to support vulnerable U.N. peacekeepers, sources familiar with the matter said.

headline.main: Exclusive: African Union Considers Mali Counter-Terrorism Force
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: African Union Considers Mali Counter-Terrorism Force

docs.snippet: In the wake of Michael Brown's death, the federal government wants to require the Ferguson Police Department to check all new hires against a database of officers who have been stripped of their law enforcement licenses for misconduct.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the wake of Michael Brown's death, the federal government wants to require the Ferguson Police Department to check all new hires against a database of officers who have been stripped of their law enforcement licenses for misconduct.

headline.main: Database of Problem Police Officers May Get Test in Ferguson
headline.print_headline: Database of Problem Police Officers May Get Test in Ferguson

docs.snippet: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has sent additional investigators to Wisconsin to find the source of a blood infection that officials described as the largest outbreak of the bacteria now linked to at least 15 deaths.
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has sent additional investigators to Wisconsin to find the source of a blood infection that officials described as the largest outbreak of the bacteria now linked to at least 15 deaths.

headline.main: Source of Bloodstream Infection in Wisconsin Unknown
headline.print_headline: Source of Bloodstream Infection in Wisconsin Unknown

docs.snippet: A Chipotle store in Massachusetts was closed Wednesday amid concerns some employees had contracted the norovirus.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Chipotle store in Massachusetts was closed Wednesday amid concerns some employees had contracted the norovirus.

headline.main: Chipotle Store in Massachusetts Closed on Norovirus Fears
headline.print_headline: Chipotle Store in Massachusetts Closed on Norovirus Fears

docs.snippet: Millennials were once a source of panic in the auto industry. Dubbed the "go nowhere" generation, they weren't getting driver's licenses, never mind buying cars. Headlines declared it was "The End of Car Culture."
docs.lead_paragraph: Millennials were once a source of panic in the auto industry. Dubbed the "go nowhere" generation, they weren't getting driver's licenses, never mind buying cars. Headlines declared it was "The End of Car Culture."

headline.main: Millennials Are Finally Arriving in the Car Market
headline.print_headline: Millennials Are Finally Arriving in the Car Market

docs.snippet: Ukrainian Prime Minister Arseny Yatseniuk urged lawmakers on Wednesday to back him, sack him or force snap elections as lawmakers held talks with potential replacements.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ukrainian Prime Minister Arseny Yatseniuk urged lawmakers on Wednesday to back him, sack him or force snap elections as lawmakers held talks with potential replacements.

headline.main: Back Me or Sack Me, Ukraine PM Tells Lawmakers
headline.print_headline: Back Me or Sack Me, Ukraine PM Tells Lawmakers

docs.snippet: Several firefighters were slightly hurt when a blast leveled several businesses as they checked on a natural gas leak in north Seattle early Wednesday, officials said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Several firefighters were slightly hurt when a blast leveled several businesses as they checked on a natural gas leak in north Seattle early Wednesday, officials said.

headline.main: Seattle Explosion Injures Firefighters, Levels Buildings
headline.print_headline: Seattle Explosion Injures Firefighters, Levels Buildings

docs.snippet: Turkey has partly completed a military campaign near its southeastern border, raising hopes an idled Iraqi oil pipeline  nearby could soon reopen after a three-week outage that has squeezed the already cash-strapped Kurdistan region's finances.
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey has partly completed a military campaign near its southeastern border, raising hopes an idled Iraqi oil pipeline  nearby could soon reopen after a three-week outage that has squeezed the already cash-strapped Kurdistan region's finances.

headline.main: Iraqi Kurdish Oil Pipeline Could Reopen Soon: Sources
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Kurdish Oil Pipeline Could Reopen Soon: Sources
